item.title: Be careful of shared array
item.description: In Go, when you take a slice of an existing slice, you get two slices sharing the same underlying array. package main import "fmt" func main() { s1 := []int{1, 2, 3} // A slice of s1 => {2, 3} s2 := s1[1:3] // The 0th element of s2 is the 1th element of s1 s2[0] = 42 fmt.Println(s1) // [1 42 3] fmt.Println(s2) // [42 3] } And we can append items to slices with the built-in function append.
